title: Can Riot Do A Gay Couple?
body:
So couples aren't a new thing in LoL.
Twisted Fate and Evelynn dated and owned a Tango Dance School.
Ezreal and Lux are a couple according to in game interactions and old lore.
And now the new champions exist.

But can Riot do a same sex couple?

We all know Graves can't have a cigar because not all regions that LoL is played in allow it, or well allow it to be a Teen Rated game in their region if drugs or alcohol use are present. (BTW Riot Gragas still has a cigarette in one of his splash arts if you want to be consistent)

Some of these regions either don't allow or don't publicly accept gay relations.
So does this effect League?

Riot's official statement is that they want League to be available to as many regions as possible, that they want to game to be as fully accessible as they can make it, which is why they took away Graves' cigar and spawned the shittastic meme.
This stand has irked members of the community from time to time, like when Riot standardized Skin Splash Art across all regions, taking away Karthus' skeletal look and a few other minor events.

So knowing this, I don't think Riot could ever introduce a same sex relationship. (sorry EzrealXTaric lovers)
What do you guys think?

replies.body:
The first thing wrong is trying to make "token" characters, those usually don't end well and they usually become more suggestively discriminating than they actually help the pack to be more diverse.

Organic design and interaction is a very important thing, you see.

If there's ever a gay couple in League, it's because they are a gay couple, not because they are THE gay couple, the latter is the usual pitfall with this kind of thing.

But honestly, I've always felt Vi to be gay (or bi) either with Cait or with Jinx for whatever reason, which if true, we may already have what you're asking for, kinda. But maybe I'm overthinking.

Oh and, Shaco was confirmed a long time ago in the Journal of Justice days where Shaco stated himself to be an "equal opportunity killer" who "goes both ways", suggesting him to be either bi or pansexual, albeit in a twisted way (JoJ may have been deleted, but this fact probably hasn't). So it's not like Riot has to keep everything ahem quote unquote "normal" (and I use the term loosely). Again, they should take their time and develop more organic characters rather than just shoehorning them.
Literally the first thing I thought of was tokenism. You know your shit, pal. üëç

I see the point you're trying to make, _(and it's an interesting one to consider)_ but my question would be: 

**Why?**

Why would a same-sex couple even be needed?
You don't want to be like modern movies and purposely put a LBGT reference in _(even when it doesn't enhance the plot at all)_, just to appease one specific part of the community. Doing that is actually more offensive to a culture/way-of-life than not.

It's like purposely giving a black guy a job over a white guy just to show that your company isn't racist, or to fill a quota. 
That Is in itself actually a racist gesture. It implies that the black guy isn't good enough to beat the white guy on his own and needs the 'guilty vote' just to get a job. The least racist thing you can do is just pick whoever is best for the job no matter the skin colour.
The same is true of sexuality.

Purposely putting in a same sex couple just to show that Riot isn't homophobic does exactly the same thing.
It basically says "You're different, so heres something we put in just for you, so that you don't moan about us!" If you just left it and let nature take its course, then thats the least homophobic thing you can do.

If a champ idea sprouts up who's kit lends itself perfectly to a same-sex couple, and that dynamic enhances the feeling of playing _(like the relationship dynamic of Rakkan/Xayah does)_, then great! use that to make an awesome champion! 
But if you try to force-fit a champion or two to be a same-sex couple, just so you can say "Hey look guys we are inclusive of gay people!" Then not only is that a waste of a champion that could have been better used for something more fitting, it also is offensive to the gay community, and points out that we have to force ourselves to include them.

What people don't realise is that by forcibly including someone, you are actually excluding them, and making the gap between you, bigger.

Imagine if your friends were only your friends because they 'had' to be, and would have been punished for being 'racist' if they didn't let you into their group.
Would that make you feel any more comfortable? Or would it just make you feel more excluded. _(It certainly wouldn't make me feel included.)_

_____

So while i don't think that the idea of a same-sex couple is something that could never happen _(with the world becoming more and more inclusive, it might well happen in the future when other regions ease up on their way of thinking.)_ But I think that unless a good idea arises that makes good use of that dynamic to enhance the game. It is pointless to even really consider it.

There is already a relationship in the game, _(and one that the majority of people can identify with)_, adding a second _(or something similar)_ just purely to include the gay community is actually an insult.  Its basically saying that "there **is** a difference between heterosexual love and same-sex love, so we have to include both to be safe!" When a real non-homophobic company would see that the love between a gay couple and a straight one is exactly the same, and so only bother to include one in-game couple _(wether it is straight or gay)_.

Thats my view on the situation, It doesn't directly answer your question though sorry, xD
It basically says, that we shouldn't even have to think about wether one is needed or not.
We should just let things happen, and if a gay couple arises then cool, and if not, then whatever.

(I personally think that updated Taric was a missed opportunity to include some tweaked sexuality into the game, everyone views him as gay anyway, and riot clearly implied it in his quotes and manner, but why not just make it official and embrace it?)

_(Also, cue the horde of people who misinterpret this post and slander me for something i wasn't even saying.)_

Lots of people want to see Taric and Ezreal officially be a couple, but Riot's already written Lux and Ezreal as a couple.

Overall the question really is, will Riot change their plan to be inclusive to all regions, as in will they eventually say "fuck it, these regions we don't care about anymore".
Since the ones I'm thinking of here, will NEVER change their ways, women don't have rights in some of these countries, and are essentially treated as a commodity rather than people. Then you have other countries who while currently are anti-gay in their government, they have quite open gay communities, and the leaders in these countries can be replaced with more open minded politicians.

We know that Riot will never (and probably can't since they are owned by a Chinese company) re-introduce tobacco or skeletons into the game.
